messages: 5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (21:56): Does anyone know of a place I can download the default stylesheet for HTML?
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (21:56): well one that is intended to set the default styles
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:56): whatwg.org/html/#rendering
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (21:57): is there one already pre-compiled together?
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (21:57): it's ok though it doesn't look like much work to put together myself
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (21:59): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: btw is there any license I may need to include at the top of the file, due to it being whatwg IP?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:01): Though a reference is always a nice thing to do
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:03): yeah I'm doing that
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:03): thanks
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:05): for br[clear=left] { clear: left; } /* case-insensitive */ etc. is the best solution to just do br[clear=left],br[clear=Left],br[clear=LEft] etc.?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:06): At this point, I guess so
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:06): CSS4 will probably bring [clear=left i]
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:08): I wish css4 would just bring xpath selectors :P
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:10): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: um #rendering doesn't say anything about the default font-family
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:10): should I assume sans-serif?
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:10): ugh man this is so incomplete
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:10): Doesn't CSS say that?
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:11): h# should have serif, right?
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:11): oh, could you link me to the relevant part of the css spec about default fonts?
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:11): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: are you an editor of the whatwg spec?
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:23): im trying to validate my first wordpress site that is using an html5 boilerplate
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:24): im gonna a message that says stray end tag section when attempting to end a section
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:24): http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fkevindankowebdesign.com&charset=%28detect+automatically%29&doctype=Inline&group=0
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:26): 2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0: there is a closing tag on line 95, but no opening tag for the next section?
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:27): the section actually starts in a seperate php file
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:27): and isnt supposed to end in that frontpagetemplate.php page, it ends on all other pages in footer.php
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:27): so i attempted to just end the section in that one php page
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:28): however i noticed i was having alignment issues surrounding that section and went to validate and saw that
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:28): only section I see is section id="content" role="main"
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:29): thats the section im attempting to end
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:29): and that ends on line and that ends on line 95
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:29): with a </section>
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:30): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: I found something relevant http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/fonts.html#generic-font-families
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:30): on other pages it ends further down
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:30): it helps because in my situation the generic font familes are broken :S
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:30): (<svg> in <img>)
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:30): in webkit
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:31): I'm confused as to what your question is, then
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:31): My question is why is it telling me its invalid
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:31): because you have two </section>
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:31): one on 95, and one on 122
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:31): for only one <section role="content" id="main">
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:32): i see what im doing wrong
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:36): due to my inexperience with html5, is there any particular reason to have the section role="content"> start in header.php or is it just developer preference?
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:36): section tags can be used anywhere right?
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:37): except for inside <head></head>
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:37): the reason for starting <section id="main"> in the header.php is because it's repeated code
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:38): and instead of having to write <section id="main"> inside of every single one of your body pages
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:38): you can just write it once
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:38): my issue is that i have additional divs that i dont want inside that section
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:38): so i attempted to end the section before the additonal divs
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:41): so then either take out the ending </section> from your footer.php
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:41): or start a new section that will be ended by the </section> inside of your footer.php
2139309b8763472169362af66ef868e0 (22:42): that might be the better solution
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:51): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: is there an easy to parse list of every html element name?
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:51): I'm going to font-family: serif; every element that doesn't use monospace
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:52): have you looked at a CSS reset?
b0e6fd6f3670395774b27a3f2db957ba (22:52): they usually have a list of every html element
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:52): http://simon.html5.org/html-elements? That's probably conforming elements only, though
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (22:52): yeah I saw that but I wasn't sure since it wasn't a spec link
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (23:15): Why doesn't CanvasRenderingContext2D.drawImage() support SVGImageElement?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:21): 5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c: probably for implementation reasons
5b9cb20d2f71fee5f77d39d8e5b3129c (23:22): it's just odd that I have to create <html:img> in my svg just to write an image to a canvas
